pageContext.claim: “We’re putting up a lot of new walls in certain areas. We’re putting up a tremendous amount of money to fix the existing structures that we have, some of which we can keep into the future. They’re in good shape, but we have to bring them back to the highest level. We’ll be doing that with this payment.
pageContext.analysis: Trump was referring to the deal to keep the government funded through September, which did not have money to build a new wall or fencing along the border, the Associated Press reported. But it does provide $772 million for border security. That money can be used to fix existing barriers, which were built under the George W. Bush administration.
